0.Pros: Good pay, flex hours, good eniroment

1.Pros: It was fun working with the people I worked with
1.Cons: Not enough money, sometimes management was not very good.

2.Cons: It is terrible. Every second you are there you want to be somewhere else.

4.Pros: Good first job, Helps you gain experience that can be used at future jobs, Can be rewarding with good management and coworkers
4.Cons: In my case, it was hard to get a raise. I was started out at minimum wage and only got a raise when I became a Crew Trainer, and that's how much I was making when I quit ($8/hr). Can also be hard to move up; I worked there for almost a year and a half before I was promoted.

5.Pros: Great bonus program and flexible hours.
5.Cons: Ownership expects great people practices out of their managers yet don't hold themselves to it.

6.Pros: great management, great starter job. day shift was a lot easier than evening shift. there is also a good camaraderie with the day shift as it is mostly older people working
6.Cons: the pay is low. not flexible when time is needed off for sick children. customers can sometimes get nasty with workers.

7.Pros: I was a good worker so they gave me lots of hours.
7.Cons: Lots of the managers don't really know what they're doing, other coworkers can be difficult, and of course customers can be bad.

8.Pros: Friendly workers, good and cheap food.
8.Cons: Not a very clean place to eat or work

9.Cons: paycheck is not enough compare to others
